0.title: Pest Watch – January (Ireland)
items: Pigeons on overwintered brassicas – use netting.
Grey mould (botrytis) in damp frames – ventilate on dry days.
Slugs under pot rims and stones – hand-pick after rain.

1.title: Pest Watch – February (Ireland)
items: Aphids on early broad beans in mild spells.
Mice taking pea/bean seeds in sheds – use secure containers.
Slugs on salad leaves under cloches.

2.title: Pest Watch – March (Ireland)
items: Flea beetle nibble on brassica seedlings – use fine mesh.
Damping-off in seed trays – improve airflow, avoid overwatering.
Snails emerging strongly – set beer traps.

3.title: Pest Watch – April (Ireland)
items: Carrot fly – cover with insect mesh immediately after sowing.
Cabbage root fly – use collars on seedlings.
Slugs on potatoes and courgettes when planting out.

4.title: Pest Watch – May (Ireland)
items: Aphids/blackfly on beans – pinch out infested tips.
Cabbage white butterflies laying on brassicas – check undersides of leaves.
Cutworm and leatherjackets in pots – disturb soil, encourage birds.

5.title: Pest Watch – June (Ireland)
items: Potato blight risk rising in humid weather – water at soil, remove affected foliage early.
Whitefly in greenhouses – use sticky cards and ventilation.
Pea moth caterpillars – fine mesh if a known local issue.

6.title: Pest Watch – July (Ireland)
items: Tomato late blight risk in warm, wet spells – prune for airflow, avoid leaf wetting.
Powdery mildew on courgettes – water roots, remove worst leaves.
Cabbage white caterpillars – hand-pick, keep mesh on.

7.title: Pest Watch – August (Ireland)
items: Blight peak season – potatoes and tomatoes especially at risk.
Onion white rot – avoid replanting alliums in affected compost.
Fruit flies around soft fruit – harvest promptly, remove windfalls.

8.title: Pest Watch – September (Ireland)
items: Slugs after frequent rain – refresh barriers and traps.
Grey mould on salads – increase spacing/airflow.
Rodents raiding stored potatoes – use rodent-proof bins.

9.title: Pest Watch – October (Ireland)
items: Clubroot on brassicas in damp soils – lime new beds/containers if needed.
Mildews in polytunnels – ventilate daily.
Vine weevil in container compost – inspect when repotting.

10.title: Pest Watch – November (Ireland)
items: Pigeons on winter brassicas – fit netting or bird lines.
Slugs under cloches – set traps, reduce hiding spots.
Grey mould on late tomatoes/peppers – clear spent plants.

11.title: Pest Watch – December (Ireland)
items: Mice on stored roots – check hessian/boxes weekly.
Ventilate greenhouses on dry days to reduce mould pressure.
Weed around garlic/clove plantings to reduce pest cover.
